text: Democratic Consent–Republican Party (, ID–PR) was a political party in San Marino. ==History== The party contested national elections for the first time in 1983,Dieter Nohlen & Philip Stöver (2010) Elections in Europe: A data handbook, p1682 when it received 2% of the vote, winning one of the 60 seats in the Grand and General Council. However, it did not contest any further elections. ==References== Category:Defunct political parties in San Marino
title: Democratic Consent–Republican Party
